result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor Alan Rubrecht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Trevor Alan Rubrecht is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Trevor Alan Rubrecht was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "C" Felony], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant remanded into custody of the St. Croix County Sheriff.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-NO CONTACT whatsoever with A.C.C., M.S.J., their familes or their residences.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant is ordered to be registered with the Sex Offender Registry for the remainder of his life.
-Defendant to go through treatment for sex offenders and to follow through with any recommended treatment and/or theraphy.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Bond will remain until restitution is determined.

supervisions.notes:
State will provide Attorney Chapman with amount of restitution requested, if there is an objection a hearing will be set.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes & Special Prosecutor Amanda Meyers, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF: Trevor Alan Rubrecht appeared.  Court called at 9:43 a.m.  Set for SEH.  Attorneys and the Court have received and reviewed the PSI.  Court modifies one error in the PSI on the record.  ADA Nieskes makes recommendation and statement.  No statements by the victims family.  Attorney Chapman makes recommendation and statement.  DE makes statement.  Crt orders:


Ct. 1 15CF496

- DE sentenced to 15 years with 8 years I/C and 7 years E/S
- Credit for 7 days served

- DE is to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.C.C., M.S.J., their families and their residences.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- DE is ordered to be registered with the Sex Offender Registry for the remainder of his life
- DE to go through treatment for sex offenders and to follow up with any recommended treatment or therapy
- DE to provide the St. Croix County Jail with a DNA sample   
- Restitution will be determined and the bail bond will remain on file until it is determined
- State to provide the Attorney Chapman with the amount of the restitution and if there is an objection then a hearing will be scheduled.
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250.00 for the DNA surcharge
- DE remanded to the custody of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department to be transported to Dodge
- 20 days to appeal
Signed by EJL c: DA. Def and DOC. km
file retained. eif

Sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward,  DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman, DF: Trevor Alan Rubrecht appeared.  Court called at 4:14 p.m.  Includes case 15CF496, 15CF503 & 15CM654.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Attorney Chapman recites the agreement.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CF496.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF496. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & Ct. 3 in 15CF496 & reads in and dismisses 15CF503 for purposes of sentencing argument & dismisses 15CM654. Crt will order the DE to receive a long form PSI and a COMPAS Evaluation and be completed no later than 05/16/16.  Set out for SEH.  Crt orders:  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb,  ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Mark Drew Biller DF:  Trevor Alan Rubrecht appeared. Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Set out for arraignment. Includes 15CF496 and 15CF503

 and  _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant and/or  _X_ Surety guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $15000.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond. 

SURETY NAME/S: Greg and Barb DeRoiser.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.C.C., M.S.J., their familes and their residences.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
